inn1.comm: on target right away, going away from the right-hander, landing outside off stump, and beating him as he came forward, not much carry though
more away movement with that round-arm action, this time he was expecting it and leaves it alone, lot of bounce on this one
bangs it in into the body, he fends it away fine on the leg side, Malinga has conceded a free-hit
bowls it full and swinging away outside off stump, he slaps it away in front of cover
bowls it wider outside off this time, consistently getting away movement, left alone
Malinga is generating lots of bounce now, pitching back of a length outside off and whizzing away from the batsman, who shoulders arms
now he bowls it on the stumps, on a length, he takes a step out and blocks solidly
starts off full outside off stump, bit if inward seam movement, he gets forward and pushes it past extra cover

Kula strikes with his second delivery! that inward movement from a length, he was pushing forward outside the line, was struck on the knee roll in front of the stumps, umpire gave him out right away, Ouma goes for the review, but that is hitting middle of middle, and Kenya's troubles continue
the incoming delivery again, but Obuya was not pushing forward, he was on the crease, and though he was not in control, managed to send it backward of square leg
now Kula gets some bounce, from short of a length well outside off, left alone
again he gets it to come in with the angle, he plays it off the back foot and it is down to fine leg for one
Waters goes pushing at this incoming delivery from the crease, and guides it down to third man for a single, good control from Kula, as always

Waters is gone! Malinga gets one of those lethal indipping yorkers bang on target, right on the toes, Waters is hurled in the air with the impact, and goes down on all fours, no one has any doubts about where that was heading, not even Waters, who gets up and starts walking back, no review from Kenya

and another one, almost, Sri Lanka scream as one in appeal, but that was headed down the leg side, it struck him outside the line of leg stump as well, but boy, is Malinga is zeroing on those toes or what
goes for the magic ball again, but it ends up as a full toss down the pads, tickled away fine, it's a no-ball as well
Collins gets this one away in to the off side to get off the strike
uff, Malinga is making them smell leather now, bangs it in short and gets it close to the helmet, he just sways out of the line in the end
this is testing stuff, he goes for the yorker now, it is not as full though, as he gets forward and pushes it down the track
Kenya have no clue about what to do with Malinga, this one was on a length and hurrying on outside off, he goes for a cut, but the edge, eludes a diving Sanga, and bounces past first slip as well
Kula into he act again, strikes him on the pads with that one that comes in, this time the umpire says no
that came back a long way, this is too good for Kenya, he did not know what to do with that, off the pads and towards square leg
another one comes in, Kenya are all at sea, just about manages to survive
now goes wider with the line, a shade outside off stump, but it comes back in sharply, he gets forward and tentatively pushes at it
pushes forward hopefully to a fuller one and gets it off the middle of the bat, and it bounds away to extra cover
and now this one goes a bit straighter outside off, and he tries to force it away through covers, but gets it to mid off
almost another one, the attempted yorker, ends up as a very low full toss, and he gets down the bat in time to push it back to Malinga
now the bouncer, getting big on the batsman outside off stump, who manages to get out of the way, yorker, bouncers, Kenya have no respite
in the air, but in the gap, full outside off stump, he went pushing at it from the crease, but it went between cover and point
length ball outside off for a change, it is left alone
another one manages to survive, Malinga gets the edge, he went pushing at it from the crease, and it bounced in front of second slip, Kenya get away this time
a rarity, a ball hits the middle of the bat, solidly defended towards cover from the crease
goes fishing for this bait outside off stump, but at the last moment reels in the bat as it whizzes past the outside edge
waits for this Kula ball to come in on off stump, and plays it towards mid on for a single
wide outside off stump, rarely does Kula get it that far away, easily left alone
extra bounce for Kula, bangs it in short of a length, and he goes for the cut, beaten by the bounce
sharp inward movement from outside off stump, sheesh, he was caught in an awkward position, jabbed away at it from the crease, and then had to stop it from doing some damage with his feet
fuller this time, pushed out in to the covers from the the front foot
confusion, but no damage, it was fended away in the air off the pads, the non-striker ran the single, half a length of the pitch two times, as David was in no mood to run
super delivery, bounces from a length with that whippy action, moves away outside off stump, he tries to steer it belatedly and is beaten
pushed to extra cover off the front foot
gets into some tangle as this one short of a length climbs on to him, brings it down in front of the wicket
another ripper from Malinga, he is doing as he pleases, and everything is on target, another one gets big on the batsman, and he has to hastily get out of harm;s way in the end
a boundary, out of nowhere, full outside off and smashed off the front foot, mid-off dives over the ball to his left, and then escorts it to the boundary
looking to play Kula's indippers from the crease, taps this to covers and takes the single
short of a length, stands tall in the crease, and punches it towards extra cover
comes in too much for David's liking, he is caught on the crease, and gets an underedge as he pushes at it, bounces close to the stumps
bowls it fuller this time, he is happy with this length, gets forward and drives to mid off
now this one straightens a shade after appearing to come in with the angle, he is taken by surprise and plays it away on to the on side
straight outside the off stump, he tries to get it past point with the push but cannot
he gives him the charge first ball, and cuts it away wide of third man
shot! gets the front foot out, to the pitch of the length ball outside off, and sends it scurrying past cover, opened the face to get it in to the gap
takes a step forward, this one comes in from outside off stump, and he gently pats it away
looking much more at ease against Angelo, comes out of the crease and drives it down to mid on, using the angle
good one from Angleo, gets it to climb outside off stump, but it is too wide, and does not trouble him much, he swayed out of the line anyways
drops it in front of the wicket, and looks for the single, but Angelo crushes such thoughts by getting to the ball quickly
shuffles across the stumps, and gets hit high on the pads, rolls away in front of square
driven wide of Murali at mid on for a single
gets forward to a length ball and pushes it down to mid on
takes a step out to a length ball and drives it to mid off this time, looking much more comfortable now that there is no Malinga around
in the channel outside the off stump, he gets around it and pushes it down the track
Kula with the surprise bouncer, gets it high above the batsman, who goes for the pull, but cannot connect, smiles from Kula, Obuya smiles back
just outside off stump, goes straight on, left alone
gets this one away fine past the lone slip, it was wide, short and sitting up, he slashed at it, and it flew past slip
now he goes on the back foot and punches a length ball to cover, hmm, can these two bail Kenya out of trouble?
oops, almost got the edge, Angelo finds some movement outside off stump, he goes driving at it from the crease, but Mathews cannot get the edge
pushed down the track, Obuya's arms keep moving around before the ball is delivered, in Caribbean fashion
another one played back to the bowler, all is well at the moment for Kenya
lovely slower one on the stumps, he was surprised initially, getting forward very early, but blocked it easily in the end
cut away down to squarish third man off the back foot, just some width offered outside off
rides the bounce on this one and punches, but short extra cover is in the way
lazy waft outside off stump from the crease, got away with it, the ball kept low, went under the bat, and died on Sanga
has the pitch eased out, is the pace friendlier now, have they settled in, another length delivery is calmly patted away to short extra cover
pushed away off the back foot in to the off side again
reaches out a long way outside off, and slashes, it flies in the air and drops short of third man
comes in with the angle, around off stump at a friendly pace, and he pushes it down the track
blocked off the back foot
now this one is guided away to point
spirited away wide of mid on, it was fullish on the leg stump
goes for the cut shot, it did not get up that much, and he mistimed it to point
draws him forward with one that turns away, Sanga appeals for caught behind, but there was no edge
Sanga misses a possible stumping chance, he was lured out again with a loopy one, but Sanga missed the take in his eagerness to break the stumps
very full, dug out back to the bowler
goes forward in defence and gets it in the middle of the bat
pushes forward uncertainly and understandably, they seem to have no clue how to handle him, it scoots away to covers
now he gets an inside edge, this one does not turn away, but he is safe as the ball goes towards square leg
much more comfortable against medium-pace on this wicket, slaps this length ball away off the back foot, again one that does not bounce much
takes a step down the track, and plays this one away towards mid on
the latest cut ever I guess, it as short and sitting up outside off, he stood looking at it wondering what should be done, and in the end just about managed to get it down to third man
walloped off the front foot in to the covers
getting forward almost every delivery now, pushes this one out to cover
threatens to hit this one out of the ground with a heave-ho outside off stump, but the threat remains just that, he does not connect
very full on the stumps, dug out awkwardly to mid off
the wrong 'un, and nicely tossed up outside off, he gets a big inside edge as he looks to dismiss it through extra cover
goes straight on around off stump, he reads it off the pitch and plays it out towards slip
another straighter one, this time on leg stump, worked away in front of square
tossed up generously on leg stump, they are having nothing silly to do with Mendis, calmly patted down the track
goes right back to a shortish one and again pushed it back to Mendis. Extreme caution
slower ball from Mathews, David dinks it to mid on for a single.
back of a length outside off, he hangs back in the crease and steers straight to point

short ball and a lovely pull shot. Shot of a man who has given up legspin to become a full-time batsman. Rocks back and swivels the ball on off stump round to midwicket. Finds the fielder though. There could have been two with better running.
back of a length on off stump, David rides the bounce and picks up a single through the covers
fuller length on off stump, defended down the off side
back of a length outside off and Collins misses the cut as the ball keeps low
Mendis drifts onto the pads, driven solidly down to long on for one
skips out of the crease, it is slowed through the air and landed on off stump. Defended into the off side
fuller on the pads, again driven solidly to long on for a single
googly, tossed up outside off, and I reckon the batsman did not pick it. Manages to get very close to the pitch and get it back to the bowler

whoa, some shot that. Drifting yorker of sorts on leg stump from Mendis, David seems to be slipping and tumbling over even as he swipes hard and there's a hueg puff off dust as he makes contact. Somehow, he middles the ball and it scoots to the midwicket boundary.
short and wide this time, David is beside himself with glee and overhits the cut. Gets a single behind point
full on leg stump, David manages to play it away off the front foot to the leg side
flighted outside off and straightening, defended solidly down the ground
over-pitched outside leg, easy flick for Collins once he got to the pitch of it.
whoa, lovely from the Wizard, slides a nifty offbreak that doesn't turn as much as usual and whizzes past the prod.
perfect placement at the end of it all. Murali ekes out the leading edge with a flighted ball and it balloons up alarmingly over the bowler's head and in front of mid-on. Nearly a run out in the end
well, he's dealing in leading edges here. Another tossed up ball on the stumps, another instance of early closing of the bat face, and it runs away to point
a hat-trick of leading edges. Back of a length and holding its line, he is down the track and looking to nurdle. The ball goes through mid off.
the Obuyas have added 50 for the first time in their careers. Slider on the pads, hurries past the batsman before he can play the pull and away for two legbyes to fine leg
Kumble-esque minimalism from Mendis, just enough to get the outside edge of a decent batsman, but Collins can't get bat on it as it breaks away
this time he gets it away to cover, leaning out and pushing a delivery on off stump.

Collins gets four, full marks for intent and bravery as he chips down the track despite not reading most of the over. He gets far enough to reach the pitch of the ball and then just lofts through the line over wide mid off. No fielders back, and four to the cause
flat and turning in from leg stump, clipped square off the back foot

lbw appeal turned down and Sanga goes up immediately for the review. Murali whirls it in from fround round the wicket. Did that land on middle or on leg? It straightened after landing, missed the forward prod, is he 2.5 metres ahead? The mat is in, it landed on middle alright and straightened enough but bounced a lot. Missing the stumps by close to a foot. Tarapore's call stays.
whoa, flighted on off, he goes at it with hard hands and gets a thick edge that flies past Mahela at first slip before he could have said "Mahela". Two runs to short third man
tossed up invitingly on middle, pushed back to the bowler cautiously
fractionally straighter, and very full, Collins goes for the sweep and manages to squeeza a single
well, another near leading edge. Tossed up and turning in from off, he looks to flick and misses. Off the pads into Mahela's hands. Not much of an appeal
Mendis gives ample width outside off, he was looking to break it back in, but Collins drove solidly through the covers after getting across
again he wanders out of the crease, it is the two-finger googly, slowed up in the air, and he gets far enough to smother the deviation and defend
stays back this time, picks the inward movement off the track and defends tamely
fuller and straighter, Collins needs no more invitations to play the sweep and controls the shot through square leg for a couple more
again he strolls out of the crease, misses the googly as it breaks in and gets bat and pad on it
nicely played. Too short from Mendis, clearly confused by the unpredictable walks down the pitch, and Collins cuts it cleanly away from Malinga at backward point for a couple
flighted on the pads, swiped on its way to midwicket for a single
these guys must be good at minesweeper, they know exactly when to sweep. Murali again flights on the leg stump and it is played quite easily to deep square leg
why is Murali attacking outside leg stump from round the wicket? David's not complaining. Goes down on a knee and sweeps without full for one more
whoa, this time Murali drifts it onto the off stump line, and for a change he misses the sweep
even straighter, on off stump, and Collins defends after getting half-forward
fuller on off and middle, Collins has shut shop for the over. Defended into the off side

You know the routine. Appeal. Umpire's finger goes up. The batsman reviews. Mendis slips in the googly off two fingers, lands on off stump and breaks in, the batsman misses it as he prods forward. Hits him plumb in front. And then the tracker shows it is going well over the stumps. Was the distance more than 2.5 metres? Does seem like it. So then, do you go with the predictive powers of HawkEye? Or does the umpire take a call? We won't know - only Bowden has the answers and he's not the umpire today. Ruled not out.
this seemed plumber than the previous one. David was not forward and the skidder seemed to hit him adjacent to off stump. The umpire says not out, and SL don't review it.
gets bat on ball this time, and eases it into the off side
interesting over comes to an end, worked off the pads to the leg side
uneven bounce, this scoots across outside off past Collins' attempted cut.
flat delivery on off, poked away to the off side
filghted on leg, goes for the sweep and misses. Sanga appeals and it is turned down.
Collins top edges the sweep, it runs away safely towards fine leg and they have three more.
beaten all ends up by the doosra, David was playing well inside the line.
gets a single to the leg side to end the over.
flighted well down the leg side, David tries to sweep and misses
this one turns away from outside off, he stays on the crease and punches into the covers for a single
more air, on leg stump and a hint of drift, played back down the track
stays low this one as it turns away, the cut is mistimed into the covers
Chamara Warne. Gets one to spit and turn from leg stump, Collins manages to defend from the crease to the on side
fuller and on middle, Collins presses forward and drives through mid off for one
quicker delivery outside off, he rides the bounce and taps it backward of point.
back of a length on off stump, played watchfully from the crease
tossed up offie wide outside off, Collins thinks of swinging it away and then chooses to leave
flatter, faster and straighter, Collins is on the back foot and gets the bat down just in time
aha, he skips out this time, Mendis sees him and drops the googly short, Collins is forced to adjust and defend.
now he dinks a paddle shot round the corner as Mendis turns one down the leg side
aha, David is set to play the sweep, Mendis drops back of a length and outside off, forcing him to convert the sweep into a dab to point. Looks quite funny, and gets no runs for the effort.
short ball, turns in and sits up, it is pulled strongly against the spin to the deep
flighted on middle and leg, driven back with the spin and the bowler fields
Chamara is all over the place, slides one down the leg side and it goes off the pads as Collins misses the flick
googly now, he didn't pick it and inside edged the cover drive, without moving the feet, and it almost hit the stumps
fuller delivery on off stump, played without much timing to mid on
width this time from Chamara, cracked away with the spin through point. Kenya won't mind the progress, though it is slow.
Murali at his best, foxes him in the air and gets another leading edge, but this runs away to the left of the pitch.
flights one outside off and straightens it, David hung back and was expecting more spin.
flighted this time on the stumps, David sweeps hard to the deep for one
over-pitched to the point of being a yorker and Collins digs it out to mid on for one
this one holds it line from outside off, David had no idea what it was going to do and just hung his bat outside off in case it came back in. The ball was too good for him to edge.
another sweep, they have this shot all sorted out. Flighted on the stumps and helped along to deep square leg
Chamara, like all part-timers, keeps slipping some of them down the leg side, and the Obuyas keep sweeping.

whoa, you won't see too many of those. He lost his length completely and delivered the dolly so high that it almost went outside the TV screen. When it came down it was still waist high, and cut away to the deep for one. Collins has the slowest 50 of the World Cup.
better ball, googly that actually landed, David rushes forward and defends tentatively
another one on the pads, swept really hard. Tharanga at deep square leg did really well to dive and prevent four.
finally a top-edge as one of the sweeps go wrong, but David's managed to place the mishit perfectly, and it lands at the vacant midwicket region.
Collins bunts a full ball on leg stump wide of mid on for a single to end the over
turns in from off and middle, played with the spin off the backfoot to midwicket
that's the ugliest down on a knee slog you will ever see. Looks uglier when he loses his balance as he swipes, and misses the ball too
100 up for Kenya, Collins backs away bravely in search of room outside off, Murali lands it on middle and leg and he manages to chop it into the covers
and the doosra again, David does well to read it off the wicket belatedly and get bat on it. Dabbed to point
flighted on the toes, swept straight to the man at 45.
again, Murali gives air on the middle and leg line, David softly deflects through midwicket for one
reverse swing is on display. Full yorker just deviating in from outside off, David does well to crunch it out to point
the yorker goes wrong, full toss at 142 kph on middle and David can't connect with the leg side heave
hmm, 140.2 kph and tailing in a touch, David is not picking it at all. Goes for a swipe without moving across, and gets an inside edge to square leg

that's almost the perfect yorker. Collins is on his way. The sling is in. Malinga's catapult side-arm action means it marginally tails away as it comes out of his hand before the laws of fluid dynamics take over. Around halfway down it begins to move in. Collins knows he's in trouble, he tries to cover the line. The ball tails in some more. The bat comes down. Too late, and not playing down the right line. The base of off stump takes a hammering.
another yorker attempted, but this one slips down the leg side.

146.4 kph, Malinga is getting the ball to talk. In Sinhalese. Tikolo almost looks like Kallis, for a fleeting moment, as he spots the deviation and covers the line solidly. Defended back down the track
ends with one back of a length outside off, Tikolo guides it carefully into the covers
tossed up outside off and straightening, turned off the pads to the leg side
another sweep from David, not controlled and it goes off the top edge down to deep square leg. The fielder inside the circle jumped up, but it was too high for him
the doosra fizzes past Tikolo's bat, hanging in hope outside off, expecting an offbreak.
another leading edge, Murali doesn't turn this one in either as Tikolo shapes to flick and gets it away towards mid off after playing the flick
tight line on off stump, David manages to get bat on it as he hangs it outside off and looks for the steer. Couple to third man
another doosra, they aren't even close to picking it. David sweeps and misses completely.
140.1 kph, back of a length outside off and Tikolo punches into the covers
fuller this time, not much tail in the air, 142 kph and Tikolo check-drives to mid off
slower yorker this time, Tikolo is forced to adjust the forward defensive and play it down the track, a little uppishly
this one slips down the leg side, and it is called wide
on target now, not much movement in the air, and Tikolo manages to get bat on it and he forces it to mid off
length ball, searing in from middle towards leg and it is whipped fluently by Tikolo to deep square leg
thunders in with another yorker, follows the batsman backing away to the leg side like a charm. He manages to keep it out though, and goes to the drinks break with all his toes intact.
Angelo starts off after a drink, and is steered away gently down to third man
he wanted to have a go at this one, but it was floated up very wide of off stump, and he didn't bother in the end
fuller just around off stump, and he comes forward to find mid off with the drive
goes on the back foot to one that is slightly short of a length, and punches away to sweeper cover
this one took off, wow, from just short of a length, he thought he could guide it away to third man, too much bounce for that
looks to break free with a forcing drive down the ground, but does not get much on it. Angelo does the rest
more mistiming, goes wafting at one around off stump and underedges it close to the wickets
settles into a decent length outside off stump, and it is punched down to mid off
wants to despatch this down the ground, but cannot get the fuller one past mid off, in fact it is straight to him
lovely slower one, takes its sweet time to arrive, when it does he can only block it away
the slower bouncer goes wrong for Kula, Tikolo latches on to the half tracker and pulls it away through midwicket for the first boundary in ages
Kula gets one back, bowls it on a length and it jags back in sharply to hit him high on the pads, and it rolls away towards point
tight single, plonked down in front of covers, and just beats the throw at the non-striker's end
forced away wide of mid off, he came on the front foot and swing hard at this fullish one

Dilshan plucks a rocket out of the air, and is mighty pleased with it, it was short and wide, Angelo is lucky to get that one, it was bashed off the back foot hard and scorched its way to Dilshan at point. who took it cleanly around chest height, Angelo smiles, Tikolo walks back
gets a fuller one and pats it away on the leg side
Mishra knows where his off stump is, this was too close for comfort, but he shouldered arms to one that came back in sharply with the angle, not far from off stump at all
throws his bat at this one inviting the drive outside off stump, no drive, no edge, no one is happy with that
pushed out towards extra cover and a single is comfortably jogged through
on the front foot and harmlessly pushes this one to mid off
looks to bash this one away off the front foot, too much bottom hand comes into play, and the bottom edge rolls away to point
bowls a full toss on middle and leg, but he cannot get it away, playing it wide of mid on
lots of intent from Obuya, but the timing is not coming off, he slogs this one away off the underedge back to the bowler on the bounce
now Kula goes for the yorker, but gets it down the leg side, marginally off target, bounds away off the pads fine
pushes this one away for a quick single towards covers
gets it to turn from around off stump, too much for the batsman. he is beaten
now the one that goes straight on, super stuff from Ajantha, he jabs it away on the off side awkwardly
gets forward and goes for the big drive, mistimes it to mid off
now he stretched well forward in defence
more tight defence from Mishra, can't do anything else with this
the shortish length allows him to go back and he plays it back to the bowler
manages to dig out a yorker on middle stump, a touch easier when its not at Malinga's pace
gets to his 50 now, comes forward and slaps a length ball wide of extra cover, and far away from sweeper cover too
slogged away from the crease, and it goes along the ground to long on
punched away off the back foot, extra cover fields, no power on the shot
remains in the crease to play the incoming delivery towards midwicket
another one comes in off the seam, takes Mishra by surprise a bit, but he plays it out in to the leg side in the end, helps if your mind is just on survival

Murali jogs in, and bowls a flighted one from round the stumps, he goes down for the slog sweep, and picks out the man at deep midwicket with precision, looped away high in the air and came down in his hands nicely, Obuya is gone
tosses up a full toss, it dips on him as he comes forward and pushes it down the track
nudges this one in to the leg side and goes across for the run, the throw hits the stumps, but he is in by a long way
defended off the front foot
more defence from Mishra, that's what he is doing at the moment
rides the bounce and turn on this one to play it backward of square leg

what's that? is it a plane? is it a bird? is it Rhodes? no it's Chamara Silva, a steaming yorker from Malinga, just about dug out by the batsman, but they make the mistake of attempting the single, Silva runs in from midwicket, picks up the ball, and goes flying in to stumps horizontally at the striker's end, catching the batsman way out of his ground, as the replays confirm
another yorker length ball but this time wide outside off stump, and pushes it out to point
low full toss at 143.3 kph, he gets some bat on it, and it runs away wide of mid off, for a boundary, just seemed a prod
now he goes down on a knee and looks to go over cow corner, the outside edge takes it very fine on the off side, no chance for any man, not even third man
another full toss, this one is down the leg side, and bounds away off the pads behind square

Malinga was trying this when he was firing in those full tosses, gets it right this time, the yorker crashes into the boot, too bad he could not get it out of the way, the umpire gave him the finger, but Kenya go for the review, Malinga is too tight there with the front foot, was it a no-ball, was there some part of the foot behind the landing crease, the ball then moved in late, and would have gone on to just strike leg stump, graze it as it were, the on-field call stands, it's not a no-ball, it is hitting leg, and Mishra's misery is over
follows this one as it goes away from outside off stump, Sanga collects it
the tossed up wrong 'un, he does not pick it, and pushes it away in the end
Sanga gathers another one as the batsman cannot fathom what Ajantha is upto
this one hurries straight on from a length, and he pushes hard at it, but the ball lands safely on the off side
the googly again, he goes back and tries to cut it past short third man, but cannot
super stuff from Ajantha, too good for Odhiambo, flight and turn from off stump, he pushes forward and misses, the ball misses off stump, Sanga grimaces

144 kph yorker, make way, that is headed only one way, the middle stump is shaken out of its stupor, no chance for the batsman, this is Malinga at his lethal best, want yorker, get yorker, on demand, any time

take a bow, Lasith Malinga, it's a hat-trick, he had got one on the last ball of his previous over, homes in on middle stump, nothing can stop it, least of all poor Shem Ngoche, who was just about expecting this, but could not do anything to stop it, it scorches its way past the gap between bat and pad, the shatterer of stumps has five
goes for four in four, but for once, he does not get the yorker on target, its a full toss way down the leg side
goes for another one of those crunching deliveries, but this one pitches full and he manages to push it past the bowler

it's all over for Kenya, they have been blown away by the marauder, another one sears in on the stumps, nothing can be done about it, it's destined to knock the leg stump out of its position, and does so, the batsman is only a sideshow, everything else is a sideshow, it is only Malinga, the ball, and the stumps, six wickets for the champion, the crowd roar their lungs out, got to feel for Kenya, their only mistake was to come in the way of Malinga and his targets

inn2.comm: back of a length on off and middle, defended to the offside
drops short of a length again on middle stump, it is tucked away to square leg.
slides one down the leg side at friendly pace and it is called a wide
Dilshan looks for the carve over third man, but there isn't enough pace to work with. On the bounce to the fielder at third man.
on the pads, worked away neatly through square leg for one
Dilshan doesn't like the lack of pace, and completely mistimes an on drive to mid on.
finishes with one that angles across Tharanga who lets it go to the keeper
back of a length and shaping into Dilshan who is cramped as he tries to play the cut. He gets a single into the covers

he's getting it to cut off the seam, this time cuts Tharanga in half as it angles across him before jagging in off the track. Tharanga has a lazy whip at it without moving the feet, and it misses the inside edge and the stumps.
better shot from Tharanga, opens the face and dabs a single to third man as it angles past him outside off
right, Dilshan's seen enough. He gets one short, he seemed to be waiting for it back in the recesses of the crease, and when it came he arched back and slammed it in front of square leg.
Odhiambo lands this fuller, Dilshan is reluctant to come forward and check drives down the ground
again, interesting inward shape from back of a length outside off and cracked into the covers. Cramped for room.
back of a length on middle and leg, Tharanga covers the line and defends down the track

comes slower than Tharanga expected, and he was committed into the booming cover drive, so he just went through with the shot and carved it high over the infield. Took the bottom hand off at the last moment and got three for his efforts.
back of a length on off stump and defended down the track
uppish, Dilshan will give an arm for pace on the ball. Back of a length outside off, Dilshan does all he can to force it into the covers, and just gets it past the short cover
and again, this time Ongondo can't hold on as he runs down the track, Dilshan gets another one in the mid 120s, not there for the drive and he pushes back past the bowler uppishly
Tharanga cracks a boundary through point. No problem this time, the slower ball came too slowly to trouble him and was short enough for Tharanga to rock back and steer-cut through point
cramped him for room on middle and off this time, Dilshan tries to play that trademark cover drive on the up, but can't place it.
short ball outside off, shot a minute from Dilshan, another violent cut that doesn't make contact with the ball.
Dilshan will keep swinging those cover drives on the up, and eventually he will middle one. As he has now. Similar ball to 3.1, lands on a length and sits up, Dilshan savages it through the covers
boy he's swinging so hard, he is likely to do a muscle here. Slower ball outside off, waits and waits and waits, and then drives straight to cover
a poor ball now to add to Dilshan's joy. He's fidgetting on leg stump, thinking of where he should pump the next one, when he gets one on the pads and thumps it along the way backward of square
short one outside off, Dilshan must be in utter despair since his flashing cut did not manage to elude point

and again Ongondo cuts Tharanga into two with a vicious incutter from off stump. Sharp line and length here, Tharanga couldn't have done much except nudge to the leg side. Certainly not the back foot force through the off side
this time he gets the nudge away to the leg side, over to Dilshan
full ball outside off, Dilshan swipes away towards midwicket like he's playing a club bowler and gets a couple
tighter line, follows Dilshan and lands on his pads as he backs away. He tries to flick, but finds the fielder
Dilshan at his visceral best. Backs away, opens up the off side and carves away over point. Goes as high as he can, just for fun. Nearly sends it all the way too.

and another, this time he even advances down the track and Ongondo plays into his hands by dropping one short outside off. Dilshan plays the cover-slap. There's no other way to define the shot. Four more.
turns the first one from off stump to the pads, Tharanga offers no shot.
Tharanga looks to launch him over a well-populated deep field on the leg side. The timing is completely off, so he gets away with it.
flighted outside off, he goes down on a knee and looks to cross-bat it through the covers, but finds the fielder

this time he gets the boundary, with an even better shot. Ngoche triedd to cramp him on middle and leg, and the challenge was for Dilshan to generate power through the off side. He managed it, with a furious uncorking of the wrists.

well, this one wasn't such a good ball, and Dilshan picks four more with ease. Short, landing on off and turning away, you could sense Dilshan could barely wait for it to reach him. When it did, he thumped it through the square field.
over-pitches outside off, Dilshan shimmies out and forces it straight to cover
horror ball to start with, lands the dolly in his half and it comes through at a nice height for Tharanga to punch through the covers.
flat and on the pads, Tharanga works it straight to midwicket
this time it slips down the leg side and is called wide
they are bleeding from both ends now. Tharanga gets into the act with a cut shot. Kamande needs a quick crash course on pitching it up.
he also needs one on bowling them straight. Another wide down the leg side.
fuller on off, defended back to the bowler
tossed up again, Tharanga leans out and drives to mid on
swiped away. Tossed up outside off, Tharanga moves the front foot across and hoicks with gay abandon over midwicket. This is all ending too quickly.
Dilshan is in such a hurry he is motoring all over the crease, and this time he has yorked himself
again, jumps out in search of length and gets too close to the ball. He ends up forcing it down the ground for one
tossed up on the stumps, Tharanga on-drives and mid on runs across and tumbles to save four.
sees him coming this time, and holds the length back. Flat and fast defended into the off side
Some like it short. Like Dilshan. Dropped back of a length and turning away, Dilshan pounces on it with furious anger. Four through point.
now there is protection in the deep and Dilshan pings the sweeper with another well-timed cut.
Kenya will hope someone can postpone that bus that Dilshan seems in a hurry to catch. He runs halfway down the pitch and wallops on the up to mid off.

Dilshan's perished to his uncontrollable aggression. He was setting himself up to hit a four or a six, irrespective of where the ball was. It was a pretty good short ball, directed at his body. Dilshan's arrested his huge backlift, and tried late to fend it to the off side, but the best thing to do with that ball would have been to defend or leave. He ended up squeezing it to the keeper.
length ball on off stump, driven solidly down the ground.
angles one across Tharanga who looks to chop to the off side, but it scoots under the bat
short ball like he means it, Tharanga gives it the respect it deserves, drops it through point for one
over-steps this time. Otherwise a decent ball, back of a length and angling across. Sanga defended down the track

Sanga camps back on the crease awaiting a length ball, and Otieno obliges. Outside off too, which meant Sanga had the room to swing cleanly. He just extended his arms through the line and carted it over long on.
full length ball angling across Tharanga and he mistimes the on-drive
one of those rare instances when ball has beaten bat in this innings. Odhiambo moves it off the seam, away from Tharanga who is squared up as he feels for it from the crease. Close to the edge.
Tharanga is a little shaky at the moment, gets a full delivery on the pads and inside-edges the heaved on-drive to fine leg

Sanga steals a single to mid-off, who was guilty of hanging back on his heels. David Obuya took for ever to come forward, pick up and release. Sanga makes his ground, and the throw misses in any case.
back of a length and angling across Tharanga who guides it off the back foot to backward point
another one nips off the seam, Tharanga misses again as he stays stuck to the crease
good fielding from David Obuya this time, over-pitched on off stump and driven solidly to the right of David who dives away from mid off and stops
width this time outside off, Tharanga throws the kitchen sink and some of the utensils at it, gets a big outside edge down to third man.
fuller on off and drive without much timing to the covers
short of a length outside off, Tharanga stays back and opens the face to steer a single through backward point
fuller length ball on off stump, Sanga leans out and steers backward of point for a single
width outside off, Tharanga opens the face and dabs it daintily down to third man for one more
slower ball, 83 kph and comes on really slow, Tharanga nearly pats it back at the bowler.
pacy this time, Tharanga hangs back and defends down the track
angled across the batsman, he opens the face and steers to third man for one
plays all over a length ball angling in from wide of the leg stump, Sanga inside edges onto the pads and runs across for a single
fuller length on middle and off, defends from the crease to mid on

Tharanga is looking distinctly scratchy, hurries onto the front foot and then sees the ball is short of a length and angling across him off the deck. He has to adjust quickly and defend to the off side
full-toss outside off, takes Sanga by surprise and he inside-edges it to the keeper who misses. Single taken in the end.
slower ball angling across, and another inside edge from Tharanga. Single to the leg side
short ball now, good effort into the heavy ball and it took off from a length. Tharanga quickly realised the steer was not an option and tried to drop the wrists
fuller length this time outside off, but still not there for the drive. Tharanga mistimes the off drive to mid off
bouncer close to being wided for going down the leg side, Tharanga ducked early
Tharanga hasn't middle one in a while, but he's still getting the boundaries away. Short ball angling wide across him and he gets an edge down to third man.
over-pitched wide outside Sanga's off stump and he walks into the square drive. Crunches out a couple behind point
straighter ball on the stumps, Sanga covers the line and punches down the track
length ball on leg stump, Sanga looks to hang back and punch down the ground, but plays to the bowler

on the pads, Sanga is quickly inside the line as he clips square for a couple. The 100 is up, in a blink. And to think they have slowed down since Dilshan went. Fastest 100 of the World Cup, thus far.
Sanga celebrates with four more. Full toss on off stump, he reaches down the ground and laces it with the straight bat to the left of mid off. Comprehensive.
holds the length back a foot, Sanga can't time the off drive this time. Plays it back down the ground
back of a length on off and middle, Tharanga hangs back and forces it down the track
angled across again, not much room but this time Tharanga angles it away through point. That's his trademark shot.
horror wide, was headed to first slip as the slow bouncer went wrong, and the keeper could not come across and collect.
back of a length on leg stump and slanting across Sanga who punches into the off side
over-pitched outside off, Sanga can't time the cover drive too well, and finds the fielder
drags this back of a length, Sanga hangs back and bunts to the off side for one
Tharanga gets a single to end the over, staying by the line and guiding backward of point for a single
turning in from outside off, defended off the back foot
shorter ball outside off, cut away to point
this time Tharanga gets a boundary, jumping back to leg stump and opening the face while cutting to get it fine to third man
full ball on leg stump, Tharanga quietly pats it down the track
outside off this time and turning in, Tharanga drives against the spin to cover

ooh, huge appeal for caught behind turned down, and they decide not to review. Short of a length outside off, he goes for the cut and misses. They went up very confidently, but decided not to review it.
slips the first one down the leg side.
well, I can see why he's stopped bowling. A nonsense full toss, that's a lolly-pop and a dolly rolled in one, with chocolate sauce dripping from it, Sanga smacks it through midwicket.
lands this one, and in the right area, Sanga stays back and looks to force through the leg side
straighter one outside off, Tharanga doesn't pick it, and plays inside the line
fuller on the leg stump, worked off the toes quietly to square leg for one
over-pitched on off stump, too close to the batsman for him to get timing into the shot
on the pads, worked off the pads to midwicket for one
tossed up on leg stump, swept square for a single
Tharanga dumps one down the ground, runs down the pitch, gets to the flight of the ball and tees off high and handsome for four.
and a cheeky couple this time, played very softly into the covers and they are off for one more as the fielder converges slowly on it.
Tharanga is hurrying away now, he's past 50 and looking to end the agony. Prances down the track and scythes on the up through the covers for four more
and now a short ball, Tharanga is cashing in on the freebies, stays beside the line and cracks it square.

another hat-trick. This time of fours. Tharanga jumps out to a wide of off stump delivery and lofts it cleanly over the infield. The man running back from covers put in the slide and ended up in a mess along the ropes.
on Sanga's pads, he dinks it along to square leg but can't get the single.
now he gets the single, worked to the off side and it is over to Tharanga to end the game.
full-pitched on the pads, Tharanga tries to swipe across the line, but misses. Huge appeal, turned down and not reviewed.

SL have exacted crushing revenge for 2003, and symbolically it is sealed off the bowling of the hero of that upset - Collins Obuya. Flighted outside off, Tharanga swung with freedom over the covers and easily got it to go all the way.
